title: Is there a cure for existential nihilism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Existential nihilism is the belief that life has no intrinsic meaning or value. Thus, existential nihilism suggests that a single human or even the entire human species is insignificant, without purpose and unlikely to change in the totality of existence. The wonderful reality of humanity is having Free Will. Humans have the innate ability to weigh evidence, analyze and take measurements to answer, “What should I believe?” However, this question has taken people off into the bushes. The right question is, “What do I want to believe? And when you decide what you want to believe that is what you will experience. Therefore, deciding that existential nihilism is real for you that is what you will experience. Conversely, if you believe that humans have intrinsic meaning or value that is what you will experience. Reality consists of the experiences you believe are real. What is real to you may or may not be the same for everyone.Fantasies are the experiences you believe are not real.Pretending is resisting what you decided to believe.Doubt is a conflict between new decisions and old decisions. What you believe and how you believe determines your reality. To make something real you need to believe in it. For it to be real to others, they need to believe in it. To the degree that you fail to manage your beliefs, reality will remain beyond your control. Thus, “What do I want to believe?” is the operative question.
